column1: She sure is my friend. What a historic week it’s been for New Orleans and all of Louisiana! https://t.co/8SQo7yN44J
Congratulations to our very own @LSUfootball Tigers for their National Championship victory! You make our district and all of Louisiana proud. #GeauxTigers

New Orleans has lost a legend with the passing of 5th Ward Weebie and I’m sad to have lost my dear friend. May Jerome Cosey’s soul rest in power. I send my support and prayers to his family and friends during this difficult time.  https://t.co/tdfo8GRt6N

Yesterday I sent a letter to @EPA Regional Administrator Ken McQueen and @LOUISIANA_DEQ Secretary Chuck Carr Brown addressing the new air quality testing system in communities surrounding the Denka Performance Elastomer plant. https://t.co/z7bqJCOfiF
You’re welcome! https://t.co/RPFj3k0cfC
You’re welcome! https://t.co/NvqxYNzhDz

American students deserve an equal opportunity to succeed. My colleagues and I worked hard to secure critical funding for #HBCUs and other #MSIs to ensure our nation’s students of color will have pathways toward success. #FUTUREAct

I’m grateful to @TheSFIA for their consistent and long-standing support of the PHIT Act. Leading a healthy and active lifestyle should be accessible and attainable for all people. I’m proud to be the 100th cosponsor. #PASSPHIT https://t.co/e6MoywPmSj
@LaDemos You’re welcome!
The time has come to be the winter soldier. The time has come to show the courage of Esther.
Thank you for your visit! https://t.co/FMSh8Qo9w5
Wow. cc: @RepJeffries https://t.co/ZpugejU0M3

Last week I was interviewed by @cenkuygur of @TheYoungTurks on Black Indentity Extremists. I applaud @kenklippenstein and The Young Turks for their work shedding light on this issue. https://t.co/p0M6FaSnMV

I applaud @Tulane for honoring African-American trailblazers Deidre Dumas Labat and Reynold T. Décou with the new Décou-Labat Residences. They paved the way for me to enter the law school as well as  countless other students of color who came after them. https://t.co/ivYdqU5Y3R

I’m proud to honor #NativeAmericanHeritageMonth. Louisiana is home to four federally recognized tribes and Native American heritage has greatly influenced Louisiana culture. Native American history is American history we should all celebrate.

On Veterans Day today we honor the sacrifices of the courageous men and women who have fought for our comfort and freedom with endless gratitude. Though we can never repay you we earnestly thank you for your service! #VeteransDay

My sincere condolences and prayers go out to the family and friends of notable author and Louisiana native Ernest Gaines. His literary works were powerful and his contributions were immeasurable. May he rest in power. https://t.co/tAxTa4DqtD

Today’s announcement from the @NCAA was a monumental step forward in advancing the interest of student-athletes. Im glad the Student-Athlete Equity Act a bill I introduced with @RepMarkWalker played an integral role in this conversation. https://t.co/zKUFMbKeHB

Today the world lost a political pioneer and tireless champion for justice. I lost my treasured colleague and friend. A principled and passionate leader Elijah Cummings dedicated his life to public service. May he rest in power and his legacy last a lifetime. https://t.co/iBM867OKJs

Happy #IndigenousPeoplesDay to the Native American community whose strength heritage and stories have allowed America to thrive. As we recognize the grave injustices endured throughout history we also thank you for your contributions to society and honor your resilience.

Today is World Mental Health Day. Let us lend a helping hand to all those who may suffer in silence and continue to work to break the stigma around it. As we all know health is wealth and access to mental health care should be readily available for everyone in need.

Congratulations to New Orleans native Albert Woodfox for his book Solitary being on this year’s @NewYorker National Book Awards list. Albert’s fight for freedom was long fought and earned. I’m proud to know him and have worked with him along his journey. https://t.co/eXTArV5TOJ

Cokie Roberts was one of a kind. Her trailblazing work and brilliant leadership served as an inspiration to many. New Orleans and the rest of the world has lost a legend. I am saddened by her loss and send my condolences to her family in need of solace at this time. https://t.co/gpbdAxvuMb
Happy #HispanicHeritageMonth to all those celebrating in my district and across the country. Thank you for your immeasurable contributions!
Thank you Steny! https://t.co/U28V02FnZ1
Thank you! https://t.co/LAAtTGJVo2

Today @HomelandDems Chairman @BennieGThompson and I sent a letter to ICE regarding Mr. Leal’s status. We requested an urgent review of his case to consider immediate deferred action. https://t.co/puhvYjTfn5
Let us pay tribute to the lives of innocent victims and loved ones lost 18 years ago today on September 11th. May we #NeverForget their heroism in the face of hate.

I’ve been concerned about Yoel Alonso Leal’s treatment and have also been in contact with ICE about his case. After speaking with ICE leadership he unfortunately still remains in custody. I will continue working with my colleagues to advocate for the freedom Yoel deserves.

On #LaborDay today we recognize the tenacity and tireless organizing of American workers whose efforts have built and sustained our country’s workforce. Thank you for your continued contributions to society.
Congratulations to Louisiana’s own for their Little League World Series victory! You make us so proud. We will be rooting for you this weekend as you take on Hawaii. #LLWS https://t.co/1BB7bbsir7

Governor Kathleen Blanco was a peaceful warrior who will be remembered as a champion for all Louisianans. I send my deepest condolences to the Blanco family during this difficult time. May her soul Rest In Peace.

What happened in El Paso today has got to stop. Mass shootings should have no place in American society. I send my strength and condolences to all of the families and friends connected to the innocent lives that were lost.
Every American deserves to know the criminality and corruption exposed in the #MuellerReport. #RetweetTheReport
You’re welcome! https://t.co/tWw5okGm3U
Congratulations on your Wimbledon victory @CocoGauff! You make us proud. https://t.co/tqlSKJAWoi
I’d like to wish you and your families a happy and safe Fourth of July celebration today! #IndependenceDay
A good read ahead of tomorrow’s game: https://t.co/8IJG2FKdDQ

One of the greatest joys and responsibilities in life is fatherhood. Leading by example is a must since your children are always watching. They might even follow in your footsteps one day. Happy #FathersDay! https://t.co/8R4GCsyA0l
June is #ImmigrantHeritageMonth. Let’s  celebrate what has always made America the greatest nation. @NewDemCoalition #CelebrateImmigrants

This was the same man who went out of his way to take out a full page ad calling for the return of the death penalty and placed false guilt on five innocent young men. Now he admittedly welcomes help from foreign governments. You can’t get any more morally bankrupt than this. https://t.co/8OgFPrpyKs

This has been a tough week for the city of New Orleans having lost another native legend. Dr. John was a Rock and Roll Hall of Famer who proudly spread New Orleans culture through his music. May his soul Rest In Peace and his music live on forever.

Leah Chase was truly one of a kind. Her contributions to New Orleans the entire state of Louisiana the rest of the world as we know it are inimitable. She has always been in my corner and will be sorely missed. https://t.co/zDVJPUokMj

New Orleans has suffered a great loss with the passing of Leah Chase. Leah’s impact to New Orleans is immeasurable. She broke barriers as a leading chef and champion of the Civil Rights Movement. My condolences are with the Chase family at this time. May she Rest In Peace.

Special Counsel Mueller made clear today that it is up to Congress to take further action. It is the responsibility of Congress to respond to numerous cases of misconduct described in the Mueller report and to ensure that no one is above the rule of law.
Be sure to watch the hearing live at 2:00 p.m. ET here: https://t.co/RpIf8LkHtd
We will hear from @Grambling1901 President @RickGallot on why HBCUs deserve a seat at the table and how Grambling is already getting ahead of the innovation and cybersecurity training curve.

Our economic and national security depend on a thriving and diverse cybersecurity workforce. We need diverse voices to solve our most complex cybersecurity challenges. An integral part of creating a robust cybersecurity talent pipeline is recruiting from our HBCUs.

Cybersecurity is an in demand high paying field with an estimate of 3.5 million job openings by 2021. However the field lacks diverse talent. I’ll be discussing why diversity in cybersecurity matters today at my @HomelandDems subcommittee hearing this afternoon.
Congratulations to Calvin! https://t.co/A9I3eRH2SK

Sending warm and heartfelt Mother’s Day wishes to all mothers whose tireless work and endless love creates the bedrock of our communities as we know it. Thank you for all that you do. Happy Mother’s Day!
@wmason1409 @TulaneLaw Thank you Wade.
Thank you @LeaderHoyer! I appreciate you. https://t.co/jnKnpL2Hxw
“We have a solemn obligation to the constitution...if it looks like obstruction sounds like obstruction smells like obstruction it’s obstruction.” https://t.co/PwHiXuJoB8

I’m pleased that @eBay has partnered with Baton Rouge on their Retail Revival program. My district is home to some of the most innovative entrepreneurs and small businesses in the country. This partnership signals continued long term economic growth. https://t.co/I9Dl165Bc2

Today on #HolocaustRemembranceDay let us pause to remember those lost & survivors that are here with us today. We must continue to honor our Jewish brothers & sisters who’ve shown us what fortitude looks like. Together we will overcome hate and take a stand against Anti-Semitism.
Wishing a Happy Easter Sunday to all those celebrating today!

Yesterday I sent a letter to Department of Homeland Security Acting Secretary Kevin McAleenan expressing concern about where DHS is sending detained immigrants and asylum seekers. I hope to get to the bottom of this soon. https://t.co/GQ7K6w0t0p

Why can’t you just condemn these awful acts without being divisive? I thank law enforcement for their work on this but now is not the time for partisan politics. This is a time for all of Louisiana to come together. I thought you were better than this @ConradAppel. This is sad. https://t.co/ofoTkXVcsb
When women aren’t paid fairly families communities and businesses suffer. Women deserve #equalpay and America’s workforce deserves better. #PaycheckFairnessAct
Thank you for meeting with us Brian. https://t.co/4hVxyNV7qU
I 100% agree! https://t.co/fPEnyKmZeT

My heart goes out to all Iowans. Though it unsettles me that @SteveKingIA would dare compare them to the countless victims of Katrina many of whom lost their lives. When people show you who they are believe them. Steve King is a white supremacist and I won’t stand for it.

I signed a letter today along with a few of my colleagues calling on the Federal Bureau of Prisons to swiftly update calculations for good time credit increases a key provision of the First Step Act. We also look forward to a hearing before the @HouseJudiciary Committee. https://t.co/l6IrbbEhxb

I’m upset and disturbed to hear about the targeted hate and bigotry that resulted in the attacks of the Al Noor and Linwood Mosques in New Zealand. We must stand in solidarity with our Muslim brothers and sisters around the world to denounce Islamophobia and all forms of hate.
Thank you for taking the time to meet with me during your visit to Washington! https://t.co/IWMM0wU8Yr
Happy International Women’s Day! #InternationalWomensDay2019 https://t.co/WLH2AqjhRz
A smart and courageous young man and football player. He’s the real deal! https://t.co/AmLd4zSzId

It’s been 3 months since @SecNielsen has testified before Congress and even more families have been separated since then. I’ll be asking about the Administration’s border policy at the @HomelandDems hearing later this morning.

Thank you to @PastorDBMorton  for sending me a copy of your book. I can’t wait to read it. Your leadership and ministry is appreciated throughout New Orleans. #WomensHistoryMonth https://t.co/OHo8aEqGUh

This week is #PeaceCorpsWeek and @pcorpsconnect stopped by my office to talk about it. Thank you to @LSU graduate Meghan Connor and my Communications Director Jalina Porter for their @PeaceCorps service. https://t.co/RI6U0GBgDc

Congratulations to New Orleans resident @chinchilla1970 for her historic Oscar win last night in production design for her work in Black Panther. You make Nola proud Hannah! https://t.co/cb1ifAG0tR #Oscars2019
We appreciate you stopping by! https://t.co/hzkFyvtjXE
Thank you for stopping by today @LSBDC! https://t.co/7ccMSIzCg6
It’s time for paid family and medical leave in the United States. For everyone. Period. #FAMILYAct #paidleave
For far too long Congress has offered moments of silence instead of action in the wake of gun tragedies. That era is over. #EndGunViolence https://t.co/F9Pqhe5fZs

Black History is American history and we have a moral obligation to learn and share stories with those who paved the way for us. I had the opportunity to do just that with my friend mentor and living legend @WhipClyburn. I hope you'll watch. #BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/LMQHXcc0yQ
Earlier today the @HouseJudiciary held its first hearing on #HR1. https://t.co/Voitw4UPcB

Southeast Asian Americans are here largely because of the Vietnam War. The time is now to help protect these communities from deportation. They’ve played a major role in my district and in cities all across America. #RefugeeResilience

I join the countless individuals in the disappointment over Sunday’s NFC Championship game and am eager to hear from @nflcommish directly. All teams deserve equal treatment and the @Saints were clearly denied fair treatment. Read my statement below: https://t.co/hdtzxQuZv2
Glad to be back! https://t.co/yaig5ITiOD

As we pause today to honor the life and service of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. remember that his work is not yet complete. We all have a responsibility to carry his legacy of love peace and racial justice until his goal is reached. Let’s keep moving forward together. #MLKDay
